values.label: d0150 - comprehensive oral evaluation - new or established patient

highlights.text: A comprehensive oral evaluation is payable once per member, per dental practice in a three-year period when the member has not been seen by a dentist in the dental practice during the three-year period.
highlights.html: A comprehensive oral evaluation is payable once per member, per dental practice in a three-year period when the member has not been seen by a dentist in the dental practice during the three-year period.

values.label: d0150 - comprehensive oral evaluation - new or established patient

highlights.text: 1. Diagnostic Services  a. Oral Evaluations A comprehensive oral evaluation is payable once per member, per dental practice in a three-year period when the member has not been seen by a dentist in the dental practice during the three-year period. It is not payable in conjunction with emergency treatment visits, denture repairs, or similar appointments.
highlights.html:
1. Diagnostic Services
a. Oral Evaluations
A comprehensive oral evaluation is payable once per member, per dental practice in a three-year period when the member has not been seen by a dentist in the dental practice during the three-year period.
It is not payable in conjunction with emergency treatment visits, denture repairs, or similar appointments.

values.label: d0120 - periodic oral evaluation - established patient

highlights.text: A periodic oral evaluation is a payable benefit once in a six-month period. The six-month period starts from the date of the examination.
highlights.html:
A periodic oral evaluation is a payable benefit once in a six-month period.
The six-month period starts from the date of the examination.

values.label: d0140 - limited oral evaluation - problem focused

highlights.text: A limited oral evaluation for an evaluation limited to a specific oral health problem is payable.
highlights.html: <fragment-part sequence-number="143" fragment-sequence-number="128" complete-sentence="A limited oral evaluation for an evaluation limited to a specific oral health problem is payable.">A </fragment-part><fragment-part sequence-number="144" fragment-sequence-number="128" complete-sentence="A limited oral evaluation for an evaluation limited to a specific oral health problem is payable.">limited oral evaluation </fragment-part><fragment-part sequence-number="145" fragment-sequence-number="128" complete-sentence="A limited oral evaluation for an evaluation limited to a specific oral health problem is payable.">for an evaluation limited to a specific oral health problem is payable.</fragment-part>

highlights.text: These services require documentation on the claim form or attached to the claim form which specifies the medical and dental necessity of the visit.
highlights.html: These services require documentation on the claim form or attached to the claim form which specifies the medical and dental necessity of the visit.

values.label: d0170 - re-evaluation - limited, problem focused (established patient; not post-operative visit)

highlights.text: A limited re-evaluation is payable when necessary to assess the status of a previously existing condition that is not postoperative.
highlights.html: A limited re-evaluation is payable when necessary to assess the status of a previously existing condition that is not postoperative.

values.label: d0145 - oral evaluation for a patient under three years of age and counseling with primary caregiver

highlights.text: An oral evaluation for children under three years of age and counseling with the primary caregiver (D0145) is payable once every six months.
highlights.html: An oral evaluation for children under three years of age and counseling with the primary caregiver (D0145) is payable once every six months.

highlights.text: A comprehensive periodontal evaluation is payable once per member per dental practice in a three-year period when the member has not been seen by a dentist in the practice during the three years.
highlights.html: <fragment-part sequence-number="184" fragment-sequence-number="162" complete-sentence="A comprehensive periodontal evaluation is payable once per member per dental practice in a three-year period when the member has not been seen by a dentist in the practice during the three years.">A </fragment-part><fragment-part sequence-number="185" fragment-sequence-number="162" complete-sentence="A comprehensive periodontal evaluation is payable once per member per dental practice in a three-year period when the member has not been seen by a dentist in the practice during the three years.">comprehensive periodontal evaluation </fragment-part><fragment-part sequence-number="186" fragment-sequence-number="162" complete-sentence="A comprehensive periodontal evaluation is payable once per member per dental practice in a three-year period when the member has not been seen by a dentist in the practice during the three years.">is payable once per member per dental practice in a three-year period when the member has not been seen by a dentist in the practice during the three years.</fragment-part>

values.label: d0150 - comprehensive oral evaluation - new or established patient
d0120 - periodic oral evaluation - established patient

highlights.text: A comprehensive periodontal evaluation is payable once per member per dental practice in a three-year period when the member has not been seen by a dentist in the practice during the three years. It is not payable when provided with, or subsequent to, a comprehensive or periodic evaluation.
highlights.html:
A comprehensive periodontal evaluation is payable once per member per dental practice in a three-year period when the member has not been seen by a dentist in the practice during the three years.
It is not payable when provided with, or subsequent to, a comprehensive or periodic evaluation.

highlights.text: A complete series of radiographic images, consisting of a minimum of 14 periapical films and posterior bitewing images, or a panographic radiograph with bitewings, is a covered benefit once in a five-year period, except when medically necessary to evaluate development and to detect anomalies, injuries, and diseases.
highlights.html: A complete series of radiographic images, consisting of a minimum of 14 periapical films and posterior bitewing images, or a panographic radiograph with bitewings, is a covered benefit once in a five-year period, except when medically necessary to evaluate development and to detect anomalies, injuries, and diseases.

highlights.text: A complete series of radiographic images, consisting of a minimum of 14 periapical films and posterior bitewing images, or a panographic radiograph with bitewings, is a covered benefit once in a five-year period, except when medically necessary to evaluate development and to detect anomalies, injuries, and diseases. It is not payable for children under six years of age, unless medically necessary. Procedure code D0210 should be billed for a complete series of intraoral radiographs.
highlights.html:
A complete series of radiographic images, consisting of a minimum of 14 periapical films and posterior bitewing images, or a panographic radiograph with bitewings, is a covered benefit once in a five-year period, except when medically necessary to evaluate development and to detect anomalies, injuries, and diseases.
It is not payable for children under six years of age, unless medically necessary.
Procedure code D0210 should be billed for a complete series of intraoral radiographs.

highlights.text: Supplemental bitewing films are a covered benefit not more than once every 12 months.
highlights.html: Supplemental bitewing films are a covered benefit not more than once every 12 months.

highlights.text: Single periapical films are a covered benefit when necessary.
highlights.html: Single periapical films are a covered benefit when necessary.

highlights.text: Intraoral and extraoral films are payable when necessary to diagnosis a condition.
highlights.html: Intraoral and extraoral films are payable when necessary to diagnosis a condition.

values.label: d0290 - posterior-anterior or lateral skull and facial bone survey film

highlights.text: A posterior-anterior or lateral skull and facial bone film is payable when necessary to diagnosis a condition.
highlights.html: A posterior-anterior or lateral skull and facial bone film is payable when necessary to diagnosis a condition.

values.label: d0321 - other temporomandibular joint films, by report

highlights.text: Temporomandibular joint and cephalometric films are payable when necessary to diagnosis a condition.
highlights.html: Temporomandibular joint and cephalometric films are payable when necessary to diagnosis a condition.

highlights.text: Cone beam images are payable when medically necessary. Documentation of the medical necessity must be submitted with the claim.
highlights.html:
Cone beam images are payable when medically necessary.
Documentation of the medical necessity must be submitted with the claim.

d0382 - cone beam ct image capture with field of view of one full dental arch - maxilla, with or without cranium

highlights.text: Cone beam images for placement of dental implants are covered only when prior authorization for implants has been obtained.
highlights.html: Cone beam images for placement of dental implants are covered only when prior authorization for implants has been obtained.

highlights.text: c. Pulp Vitality Tests Pulp vitality testing includes multiple teeth and contra lateral comparisons and is payable when necessary for diagnosis.
highlights.html:
c. Pulp Vitality Tests
Pulp vitality testing includes multiple teeth and contra lateral comparisons and is payable when necessary for diagnosis.

highlights.text: d. Casts Diagnostic casts are payable for orthodontic cases, implants or when requested by the IME.
highlights.html:
d. Casts
Diagnostic casts are payable for orthodontic cases, implants or when requested by the IME.

highlights.text: Oral prophylaxis, including necessary scaling and polishing, is payable only once in a six-month period, except for members who need more frequent care because of a physical or mental condition (including members receiving orthodontic treatment).
highlights.html: Oral prophylaxis, including necessary scaling and polishing, is payable only once in a six-month period, except for members who need more frequent care because of a physical or mental condition (including members receiving orthodontic treatment).

highlights.text: Electronic claims should be billed with "DIS" in the appropriate segment.
highlights.html: Electronic claims should be billed with "DIS" in the appropriate segment.

highlights.text: b. Fluoride Topical application of fluoride (gel, mouth rinse) is payable once every 90 days. (This does not include the use of fluoride prophylaxis paste as fluoride treatment.)
highlights.html:
b. Fluoride
Topical application of fluoride (gel, mouth rinse) is payable once every 90 days.
(This does not include the use of fluoride prophylaxis paste as fluoride treatment.)

highlights.text: c. Pit and Fissure Sealants Pit and fissure sealants are payable for placement on deciduous and permanent posterior teeth only. Reimbursement for sealants is restricted to work performed on children through 18 years of age and for persons who have a physical or mental disability that impairs their ability to maintain adequate oral hygiene.
highlights.html:
c. Pit and Fissure Sealants
Pit and fissure sealants are payable for placement on deciduous and permanent posterior teeth only.
Reimbursement for sealants is restricted to work performed on children through 18 years of age and for persons who have a physical or mental disability that impairs their ability to maintain adequate oral hygiene.

highlights.text: c. Pit and Fissure Sealants Pit and fissure sealants are payable for placement on deciduous and permanent posterior teeth only. Reimbursement for sealants is restricted to work performed on children through 18 years of age and for persons who have a physical or mental disability that impairs their ability to maintain adequate oral hygiene.
highlights.html:
c. Pit and Fissure Sealants
Pit and fissure sealants are payable for placement on deciduous and permanent posterior teeth only.
Reimbursement for sealants is restricted to work performed on children through 18 years of age and for persons who have a physical or mental disability that impairs their ability to maintain adequate oral hygiene.

highlights.text: Replacement sealants are covered when medically necessary. Documentation in the member record must indicate that the sealant is totally or partially missing.
highlights.html:
Replacement sealants are covered when medically necessary.
Documentation in the member record must indicate that the sealant is totally or partially missing.

highlights.text: d. Space Management Services Space management services do not require prior authorization. They are payable when: • Premature loss of teeth would permit existing teeth to shift causing a handicapping malocclusion, or • There is too little dental ridge to accommodate either the number or the size of teeth and significant dental disease will result if not corrected.
highlights.html:
d. Space Management Services
Space management services do not require prior authorization.
They are payable when:
•
Premature loss of teeth would permit existing teeth to shift causing a handicapping malocclusion, or
•
There is too little dental ridge to accommodate either the number or the size of teeth and significant dental disease will result if not corrected.

values.label: d1555 - removal of fixed space maintainer

highlights.text: Removal of a fixed space maintainer is payable when performed by a dentist or practice that did not originally provide the appliance.
highlights.html: Removal of a fixed space maintainer is payable when performed by a dentist or practice that did not originally provide the appliance.

values.label: early and periodic screening, diagnostic and treatment

highlights.text: e. Care for Kids Early and periodic screening, diagnosis, and treatment (known in Iowa as the "Care for Kids" program) is covered for children under 21 years of age who are eligible for Medicaid.
highlights.html:
e. Care for Kids
Early and periodic screening, diagnosis, and treatment (known in Iowa as the "Care for Kids" program) is covered for children under 21 years of age who are eligible for Medicaid.

highlights.text: 3. Restorative Services Restorative services are payable when there is a fair to good prognosis for maintaining the tooth.
highlights.html:
3. Restorative Services
Restorative services are payable when there is a fair to good prognosis for maintaining the tooth.

highlights.text: 3. Restorative Services
highlights.html: 3. Restorative Services

highlights.text: Treatment of dental caries is covered in those areas that require immediate attention.
highlights.html: Treatment of dental caries is covered in those areas that require immediate attention.

highlights.text: Medicaid covers amalgam or composite resin filling material. Restorations are payable benefits for treatment of dental caries and are reimbursable only once in a two-year period.
highlights.html:
Medicaid covers amalgam or composite resin filling material.
Restorations are payable benefits for treatment of dental caries and are reimbursable only once in a two-year period.

highlights.text: Tooth preparation, temporary restorations, cement bases, pulp capping, impressions, local anesthesia, and inhaled anesthesia are included in the restorative fee and may not be billed separately.
highlights.html: Tooth preparation, temporary restorations, cement bases, pulp capping, impressions, local anesthesia, and inhaled anesthesia are included in the restorative fee and may not be billed separately.

highlights.text: An amalgam or composite restoration is not payable following a sedative filling in the same tooth unless the sedative filling was placed more than 30 days previously.
highlights.html: An amalgam or composite restoration is not payable following a sedative filling in the same tooth unless the sedative filling was placed more than 30 days previously.

highlights.text: There is no limit on the number of stainless steel crowns that may be allowed in a 12-month period, as long as they are medically necessary.
highlights.html: There is no limit on the number of stainless steel crowns that may be allowed in a 12-month period, as long as they are medically necessary.

values.label: d2933 - prefabricated stainless steel crown with resin window

highlights.text: Prefabricated stainless steel crowns with a resin window are covered for anterior teeth only.
highlights.html: <fragment-part sequence-number="331" fragment-sequence-number="303" complete-sentence="Prefabricated stainless steel crowns with a resin window are covered for anterior teeth only.">Prefabricated stainless steel crowns </fragment-part><fragment-part sequence-number="332" fragment-sequence-number="303" complete-sentence="Prefabricated stainless steel crowns with a resin window are covered for anterior teeth only.">with a resin window are covered for anterior teeth only. </fragment-part>

values.label: d2934 - prefabricated esthetic coated stainless steel crown - primary tooth

highlights.text: Esthetic coated stainless steel crowns are covered only on primary anterior teeth numbers C through H and M through R. One crown per each primary anterior tooth is allowed. Prior authorization is not required.
highlights.html:
Esthetic coated stainless steel crowns are covered only on primary anterior teeth numbers C through H and M through R. One crown per each primary anterior tooth is allowed.
Prior authorization is not required.

values.label: laboratory fabricated crowns utilizing non-precious materials

highlights.text: All laboratory-fabricated crowns utilizing non-precious materials require prior authorization. Approval shall be granted when: • Coronal loss of tooth structure does not allow restoration with a composite or amalgam restoration, or • There is evidence of recurring decay surrounding a large existing restoration, or • The tooth is fractured or has a broken cusp, or • The tooth has had endodontic treatment.
highlights.html:
All laboratory-fabricated crowns utilizing non-precious materials require prior authorization.
Approval shall be granted when:
•
Coronal loss of tooth structure does not allow restoration with a composite or amalgam restoration, or
•
There is evidence of recurring decay surrounding a large existing restoration, or
•
The tooth is fractured or has a broken cusp, or
•
The tooth has had endodontic treatment.

highlights.text: Crowns using noble metals are payable when the member meets the criteria for a crown and the member is allergic to all other restoration materials. Prior authorization is required.
highlights.html:
Crowns using noble metals are payable when the member meets the criteria for a crown and the member is allergic to all other restoration materials.
Prior authorization is required.

highlights.text: A replacement crown for the same tooth in less than 18 months due to failure of the crown is not covered and is the responsibility of the dentist who originally placed the crown.
highlights.html: <fragment-part sequence-number="363" fragment-sequence-number="330" complete-sentence="A replacement crown for the same tooth in less than 18 months due to failure of the crown is not covered and is the responsibility of the dentist who originally placed the crown.">A replacement crown </fragment-part><fragment-part sequence-number="364" fragment-sequence-number="330" complete-sentence="A replacement crown for the same tooth in less than 18 months due to failure of the crown is not covered and is the responsibility of the dentist who originally placed the crown.">for the same tooth in less than 18 months due to failure of the crown is not covered and is the responsibility of the dentist who originally placed the crown. </fragment-part>

highlights.text: Restoration is not payable following a sedative filling in the same tooth, unless the sedative filling was placed more than 30 days previously.
highlights.html: <fragment-part sequence-number="371" fragment-sequence-number="337" complete-sentence="Restoration is not payable following a sedative filling in the same tooth, unless the sedative filling was placed more than 30 days previously.">Restoration is not payable following a </fragment-part><fragment-part sequence-number="372" fragment-sequence-number="337" complete-sentence="Restoration is not payable following a sedative filling in the same tooth, unless the sedative filling was placed more than 30 days previously.">sedative filling </fragment-part><fragment-part sequence-number="373" fragment-sequence-number="337" complete-sentence="Restoration is not payable following a sedative filling in the same tooth, unless the sedative filling was placed more than 30 days previously.">in the same tooth, unless the sedative filling was placed more than 30 days previously. </fragment-part>

values.label: d2954 - prefabricated post and core in addition to crown
d2952 - post and core in addition to crown, indirectly fabricated

highlights.text: Cast post and core, post and composite, or post and amalgam, in addition to a crown, are a covered benefit when the tooth is functional and the integrity of the tooth would be jeopardized by no post support.
highlights.html: <fragment-part sequence-number="374" fragment-sequence-number="338" complete-sentence="Cast post and core, post and composite, or post and amalgam, in addition to a crown, are a covered benefit when the tooth is functional and the integrity of the tooth would be jeopardized by no post support.">Cast post and core, post and composite, or post and amalgam, </fragment-part><fragment-part sequence-number="375" fragment-sequence-number="338" complete-sentence="Cast post and core, post and composite, or post and amalgam, in addition to a crown, are a covered benefit when the tooth is functional and the integrity of the tooth would be jeopardized by no post support.">in addition to a crown, are a covered benefit when the tooth is functional and the integrity of the tooth would be jeopardized by no post support. </fragment-part>

highlights.text: Crown repair is payable. For pricing purposes, documentation of the repair must be submitted with the claim.
highlights.html:
Crown repair is payable.
For pricing purposes, documentation of the repair must be submitted with the claim.

values.label: d2999 - unspecified restorative procedure, by report

highlights.text: Unspecified restorative procedures require documentation of medical necessity submitted with the claim and may not be payable.
highlights.html: Unspecified restorative procedures require documentation of medical necessity submitted with the claim and may not be payable.

highlights.text: Root canal treatments on permanent anterior and posterior teeth are a covered benefit when there is a presence of extensive decay, infection, draining fistulas, severe pain upon chewing or applied pressure, prolonged sensitivity to temperatures, or a discolored tooth indicative of a non-vital tooth. Root canal treatments do not require prior approval.
highlights.html:
Root canal treatments on permanent anterior and posterior teeth are a covered benefit when there is a presence of extensive decay, infection, draining fistulas, severe pain upon chewing or applied pressure, prolonged sensitivity to temperatures, or a discolored tooth indicative of a non-vital tooth.
Root canal treatments do not require prior approval.

highlights.text: Root canal retreatment requires prior approval and may be allowed when: • The conventional treatment has been completed, • A reasonable time (approximately one year) has elapsed, and • The failure has been demonstrated with a radiograph and narrative history.
highlights.html:
Root canal retreatment requires prior approval and may be allowed when:
•
The conventional treatment has been completed,
•
A reasonable time (approximately one year) has elapsed, and
•
The failure has been demonstrated with a radiograph and narrative history.

highlights.text: Vital pulpotomies are clinical findings and do not require prior approval. Cement bases, pulp capping, and insulating liners are considered part of the restoration and must not be billed separately.
highlights.html:
Vital pulpotomies are clinical findings and do not require prior approval.
Cement bases, pulp capping, and insulating liners are considered part of the restoration and must not be billed separately.

highlights.text: Vital pulpotomies are clinical findings and do not require prior approval. Cement bases, pulp capping, and insulating liners are considered part of the restoration and must not be billed separately.
highlights.html:
Vital pulpotomies are clinical findings and do not require prior approval.
Cement bases, pulp capping, and insulating liners are considered part of the restoration and must not be billed separately.

values.label: d4355 - full mouth debridement to enable comprehensive evaluation and diagnosis

highlights.text: 5. Periodontal Services Full-mouth debridement to enable comprehensive periodontal evaluation and diagnosis is a covered service and does not require prior approval. It is payable once in a 24-month period. Full-mouth debridement is not payable on the same date of services as other prophylactic or preventive procedures.
highlights.html:
5. Periodontal Services
Full-mouth debridement to enable comprehensive periodontal evaluation and diagnosis is a covered service and does not require prior approval.
It is payable once in a 24-month period.
Full-mouth debridement is not payable on the same date of services as other prophylactic or preventive procedures.

values.label: d4355 - full mouth debridement to enable comprehensive evaluation and diagnosis

highlights.text: Full-mouth debridement to enable comprehensive periodontal evaluation and diagnosis is a covered service and does not require prior approval. It is payable once in a 24-month period. Full-mouth debridement is not payable on the same date of services as other prophylactic or preventive procedures
highlights.html:
Full-mouth debridement to enable comprehensive periodontal evaluation and diagnosis is a covered service and does not require prior approval.
It is payable once in a 24-month period.
Full-mouth debridement is not payable on the same date of services as other prophylactic or preventive procedures

highlights.text: Periodontal scaling and root planing, gingivoplasty, osseous surgery, osseous allograft, pedicle soft tissue graft, free soft tissue graft, and maintenance therapy are covered periodontic benefits when prior approval has been received. A request for approval must be accompanied by: • A periodontal treatment plan, • A completed copy of a periodontic probe chart that exhibits pocket depths, • A periodontal history, and • Radiographs. Payment for periodontal scaling and root planing will be approved when: • The periodontal probe chart evidences active periodontal disease, • Interproximal and subgingival calculus is evident in X-rays, or • You justify and document that curettage, scaling, or root planing is required in addition to routine prophylaxis.
highlights.html:
Periodontal scaling and root planing, gingivoplasty, osseous surgery, osseous allograft, pedicle soft tissue graft, free soft tissue graft, and maintenance therapy are covered periodontic benefits when prior approval has been received.
A request for approval must be accompanied by:
•
A periodontal treatment plan,
•
A completed copy of a periodontic probe chart that exhibits pocket depths,
•
A periodontal history, and
•
Radiographs.
Payment for periodontal scaling and root planing will be approved when:
•
The periodontal probe chart evidences active periodontal disease,
•
Interproximal and subgingival calculus is evident in X-rays, or
•
You justify and document that curettage, scaling, or root planing is required in addition to routine prophylaxis.

highlights.text: Periodontal maintenance therapy requires prior approval and includes oral prophylaxis, measurement of pocket depths and limited root planing and scaling. This procedure may be approved once per three-month interval after periodontal scaling and root planing and periodontal surgical procedures have been provided as long as periodontal charting shows evidence of active periodontal disease (pocket depths of 4 mm or greater, inflammation or bleeding on probing). If pocket depths have returned to 3 mm or less, and there are no signs of active periodontal disease, quarterly prophylaxis should be provided instead.
highlights.html:
Periodontal maintenance therapy requires prior approval and includes oral prophylaxis, measurement of pocket depths and limited root planing and scaling.
This procedure may be approved once per three-month interval after periodontal scaling and root planing and periodontal surgical procedures have been provided as long as periodontal charting shows evidence of active periodontal disease (pocket depths of 4 mm or greater, inflammation or bleeding on probing).
If pocket depths have returned to 3 mm or less, and there are no signs of active periodontal disease, quarterly prophylaxis should be provided instead.

highlights.text: Periodontal maintenance therapy requires prior approval and includes oral prophylaxis, measurement of pocket depths and limited root planing and scaling. This procedure may be approved once per three-month interval after periodontal scaling and root planing and periodontal surgical procedures have been provided as long as periodontal charting shows evidence of active periodontal disease (pocket depths of 4 mm or greater, inflammation or bleeding on probing). If pocket depths have returned to 3 mm or less, and there are no signs of active periodontal disease, quarterly prophylaxis should be provided instead.
highlights.html:
Periodontal maintenance therapy requires prior approval and includes oral prophylaxis, measurement of pocket depths and limited root planing and scaling.
This procedure may be approved once per three-month interval after periodontal scaling and root planing and periodontal surgical procedures have been provided as long as periodontal charting shows evidence of active periodontal disease (pocket depths of 4 mm or greater, inflammation or bleeding on probing).
If pocket depths have returned to 3 mm or less, and there are no signs of active periodontal disease, quarterly prophylaxis should be provided instead.

highlights.text: Periodontal surgical procedures, including gingivectomy, osseous surgery, and osseous allograft, will be approved after: • Periodontal scaling and root planing has been provided, • A re-evaluation examination has been completed, and • The member has demonstrated reasonable oral hygiene, unless the member is unable to demonstrate reasonable oral hygiene because of physical or mental disability or demonstrate gingival hyperplasia resulting from drug therapy.
highlights.html:
Periodontal surgical procedures, including gingivectomy, osseous surgery, and osseous allograft, will be approved after:
•
Periodontal scaling and root planing has been provided,
•
A re-evaluation examination has been completed, and
•
The member has demonstrated reasonable oral hygiene, unless the member is unable to demonstrate reasonable oral hygiene because of physical or mental disability or demonstrate gingival hyperplasia resulting from drug therapy.

highlights.text: Pedicle soft tissue graft and free soft tissue graft are payable services with prior approval and written narrative describing medical necessity.
highlights.html: <fragment-part sequence-number="479" fragment-sequence-number="430" complete-sentence="Pedicle soft tissue graft and free soft tissue graft are payable services with prior approval and written narrative describing medical necessity.">Pedicle soft tissue graft and free soft tissue graft </fragment-part><fragment-part sequence-number="480" fragment-sequence-number="430" complete-sentence="Pedicle soft tissue graft and free soft tissue graft are payable services with prior approval and written narrative describing medical necessity.">are payable services with prior approval and written narrative describing medical necessity.</fragment-part>

highlights.text: Tissue regeneration procedures are payable when radiographs show evidence of recession in relation to the muco-gingival junction and the bone level indicates the tooth has a fair to good prognosis. Prior authorization is required.
highlights.html:
Tissue regeneration procedures are payable when radiographs show evidence of recession in relation to the muco-gingival junction and the bone level indicates the tooth has a fair to good prognosis.
Prior authorization is required.

values.label: d4381 - localized delivery of antimicrobial agents via a controlled release vehicle into diseased crevicular tissue, per tooth, by report

highlights.text: Localized delivery of antimicrobial agents requires prior authorization and is limited to once per site every twelve months.
highlights.html: <fragment-part sequence-number="484" fragment-sequence-number="433" complete-sentence="Localized delivery of antimicrobial agents requires prior authorization and is limited to once per site every twelve months.">Localized delivery of </fragment-part><fragment-part sequence-number="485" fragment-sequence-number="433" complete-sentence="Localized delivery of antimicrobial agents requires prior authorization and is limited to once per site every twelve months.">antimicrobial agents </fragment-part><fragment-part sequence-number="486" fragment-sequence-number="433" complete-sentence="Localized delivery of antimicrobial agents requires prior authorization and is limited to once per site every twelve months.">requires prior authorization and is limited to once per site every twelve months.</fragment-part>

highlights.text: 6. Prosthetics  a. Dentures Complete and partial dentures are payable once in a five year period.
highlights.html:
6. Prosthetics
a. Dentures
Complete and partial dentures are payable once in a five year period.

highlights.text: 6. Prosthetics  a. Dentures Complete and partial dentures are payable once in a five year period. The date of service for the denture is the date the denture was placed. Reimbursement includes six months fitting and follow-up.
highlights.html:
6. Prosthetics
a. Dentures
Complete and partial dentures are payable once in a five year period.
The date of service for the denture is the date the denture was placed.
Reimbursement includes six months fitting and follow-up.

conditions.displayName: member - no medical history of treatment

highlights.text: 6. Prosthetics
highlights.html: 6. Prosthetics

highlights.text: b. Complete Dentures An immediate or a first-time complete denture is a covered benefit when the denture is provided to establish masticatory function.
highlights.html:
b. Complete Dentures
An immediate or a first-time complete denture is a covered benefit when the denture is provided to establish masticatory function.

highlights.text: b. Complete Dentures An immediate or a first-time complete denture is a covered benefit when the denture is provided to establish masticatory function. Six months post-delivery care is included with the reimbursement for the denture
highlights.html:
b. Complete Dentures
An immediate or a first-time complete denture is a covered benefit when the denture is provided to establish masticatory function.
Six months post-delivery care is included with the reimbursement for the denture

highlights.text: c. Removable Partial Dentures Removable partial dentures require prior authorization. Approval shall be granted for replacement of a missing anterior tooth when radiographs demonstrate adequate space for replacement of a missing anterior tooth. Approval for a removable partial denture replacing posterior teeth shall be granted when: • The member has fewer than eight posterior teeth in occlusion, or • The member has a full denture in one arch, and a partial denture replacing posterior teeth is required in the opposing arch to balance occlusion. When one removable partial denture brings eight posterior teeth in occlusion, no additional removable partial denture will be approved.
highlights.html:
c. Removable Partial Dentures
Removable partial dentures require prior authorization.
Approval shall be granted for replacement of a missing anterior tooth when radiographs demonstrate adequate space for replacement of a missing anterior tooth.
Approval for a removable partial denture replacing posterior teeth shall be granted when:
•
The member has fewer than eight posterior teeth in occlusion, or
•
The member has a full denture in one arch, and a partial denture replacing posterior teeth is required in the opposing arch to balance occlusion.
When one removable partial denture brings eight posterior teeth in occlusion, no additional removable partial denture will be approved.

highlights.text: d. Fixed Partial Dentures Fixed partial dentures require prior approval and are limited to members whose medical or mental condition precludes the use of a removable partial denture. Approval for fixed partial dentures replacing only posterior teeth is limited to members who have: • Fewer than eight posterior teeth in occlusion, or • A full denture in one arch and a partial denture replacing posterior teeth are required in the opposing arch to balance occlusion. High noble or noble metals shall be approved only when the member is allergic to all other restorative materials.
highlights.html:
d. Fixed Partial Dentures
Fixed partial dentures require prior approval and are limited to members whose medical or mental condition precludes the use of a removable partial denture.
Approval for fixed partial dentures replacing only posterior teeth is limited to members who have:
•
Fewer than eight posterior teeth in occlusion, or
•
A full denture in one arch and a partial denture replacing posterior teeth are required in the opposing arch to balance occlusion.
High noble or noble metals shall be approved only when the member is allergic to all other restorative materials.

highlights.text: e. Replacement Dentures Replacement of complete dentures, removable partial dentures, and fixed partial dentures requires prior authorization and is limited to once per prosthesis in a five-year period. Approval shall be granted once per denture per arch when the denture is lost, broken beyond repair, stolen or no longer fits due to growth or changes in the jaw structure and a replacement is required to prevent significant dental problems. Approval shall also be granted for more than one denture replacement per arch in less than five years for members who have a medical condition that necessitates thorough mastication.
highlights.html:
e. Replacement Dentures
Replacement of complete dentures, removable partial dentures, and fixed partial dentures requires prior authorization and is limited to once per prosthesis in a five-year period.
Approval shall be granted once per denture per arch when the denture is lost, broken beyond repair, stolen or no longer fits due to growth or changes in the jaw structure and a replacement is required to prevent significant dental problems.
Approval shall also be granted for more than one denture replacement per arch in less than five years for members who have a medical condition that necessitates thorough mastication.

highlights.text: e. Replacement Dentures
highlights.html: e. Replacement Dentures

highlights.text: Replacement of a complete or partial denture in less than five years due to resorption is not covered.
highlights.html: Replacement of a complete or partial denture in less than five years due to resorption is not covered.

highlights.text: Adjustments to a complete or removable partial denture are payable when medically necessary after six months' post-delivery care. An adjustment consists of removal of acrylic material or adjustment of teeth to eliminate a sore area or to make the denture fit better. Warming dentures and massaging them for better fit or placing them in a sonic device does not constitute an adjustment
highlights.html:
Adjustments to a complete or removable partial denture are payable when medically necessary after six months' post-delivery care.
An adjustment consists of removal of acrylic material or adjustment of teeth to eliminate a sore area or to make the denture fit better.
Warming dentures and massaging them for better fit or placing them in a sonic device does not constitute an adjustment

highlights.text: Adjustments to a complete or removable partial denture are payable when medically necessary after six months' post-delivery care. An adjustment consists of removal of acrylic material or adjustment of teeth to eliminate a sore area or to make the denture fit better. Warming dentures and massaging them for better fit or placing them in a sonic device does not constitute an adjustment.
highlights.html:
Adjustments to a complete or removable partial denture are payable when medically necessary after six months' post-delivery care.
An adjustment consists of removal of acrylic material or adjustment of teeth to eliminate a sore area or to make the denture fit better.
Warming dentures and massaging them for better fit or placing them in a sonic device does not constitute an adjustment.

highlights.text: Rebase of a complete or partial denture requires prior authorization. Approval shall be granted when the acrylic of the denture is cracked or has had numerous repairs and the teeth are on good condition.
highlights.html:
Rebase of a complete or partial denture requires prior authorization.
Approval shall be granted when the acrylic of the denture is cracked or has had numerous repairs and the teeth are on good condition.

highlights.text: c. Implants Dental implants and related services require prior authorization. Approval may be granted when the member cannot use a conventional prosthetic due to: • Missing significant oral structures subsequent to cancer, traumatic injuries, etc., or • Developmental defects such as cleft palate.
highlights.html:
c. Implants
Dental implants and related services require prior authorization.
Approval may be granted when the member cannot use a conventional prosthetic due to:
•
Missing significant oral structures subsequent to cancer, traumatic injuries, etc., or
•
Developmental defects such as cleft palate.

highlights.text: Routine postoperative care is considered part of the fee for surgical procedures and may not be billed separately.

values.label: d7880 - occlusal orthotic device, by report

highlights.text: 10. Orthodontics Orthodontic services are not covered for adults 21 years of age and older, except for an occlusal orthotic appliance.
highlights.html:
10. Orthodontics
Orthodontic services are not covered for adults 21 years of age and older, except for an occlusal orthotic appliance.

highlights.text: Orthodontic procedures require prior approval.
highlights.html: Orthodontic procedures require prior approval.

values.label: d7880 - occlusal orthotic device, by report

highlights.text: An occlusal orthotic device that includes splints may be allowed for both children and adults with severe temporomandibular joint dysfunction due to structure problems with the joint and surrounding musculature.
highlights.html: An occlusal orthotic device that includes splints may be allowed for both children and adults with severe temporomandibular joint dysfunction due to structure problems with the joint and surrounding musculature.

values.label: d9110 - palliative (emergency) treatment of dental pain - minor procedure

highlights.text: a. Emergency Treatment Minor palliative treatment of dental pain is covered in emergency situations when there is no other specific procedure code that defines the treatment. Examples include treatment of soft tissue infections or smoothing a fractured tooth
highlights.html:
a. Emergency Treatment
Minor palliative treatment of dental pain is covered in emergency situations when there is no other specific procedure code that defines the treatment.
Examples include treatment of soft tissue infections or smoothing a fractured tooth

highlights.text: Documentation of a description of the treatment must be included with the claim.
highlights.html: Documentation of a description of the treatment must be included with the claim.

highlights.text: The code may be billed in addition to a limited oral evaluation, radiographs, or other diagnostic procedures. It should not be billed on the same date of service as other treatment procedures on the same tooth, nor for other multi-visit treatments such as endodontics or orthodontics. Documentation of a description of the treatment must be included with the claim.
highlights.html:
The code may be billed in addition to a limited oral evaluation, radiographs, or other diagnostic procedures.
It should not be billed on the same date of service as other treatment procedures on the same tooth, nor for other multi-visit treatments such as endodontics or orthodontics.
Documentation of a description of the treatment must be included with the claim.

highlights.text: Application of a desensitizing medicament is payable on a per visit basis for tooth or root sensitivity.

highlights.text: c. Professional Consultation
highlights.html: c. Professional Consultation

highlights.text: The consultation includes an oral evaluation, which is not separately payable.
highlights.html: The consultation includes an oral evaluation, which is not separately payable.

values.label: d9420 - hospital or ambulatory surgical center call

highlights.text: A hospital or ambulatory surgical center visit is payable when the mental, physical, or emotional condition of the member prevents the dentist from providing necessary care in the office. Payment is allowed once per member per day, in addition to other dental services provided.
highlights.html:
A hospital or ambulatory surgical center visit is payable when the mental, physical, or emotional condition of the member prevents the dentist from providing necessary care in the office.
Payment is allowed once per member per day, in addition to other dental services provided.

highlights.text: (1) Occlusal Guard An occlusal guard for treatment of severe bruxism and other occlusal factors requires prior authorization. Approval shall be granted when photographs support evidence of significant loss of tooth enamel or tooth chipping, or the medical documentation supports headaches or jaw pain. Replacements due to loss, theft or damage are limited to once every 12 months.
highlights.html:
(1) Occlusal Guard
An occlusal guard for treatment of severe bruxism and other occlusal factors requires prior authorization.
Approval shall be granted when photographs support evidence of significant loss of tooth enamel or tooth chipping, or the medical documentation supports headaches or jaw pain.
Replacements due to loss, theft or damage are limited to once every 12 months.

values.label: d0150 - comprehensive oral evaluation - new or established patient

highlights.text: A comprehensive oral evaluation is payable once per member, per dental practice in a three-year period when the member has not been seen by a dentist in the dental practice during the three-year period.
